subject: Re: [junit] Re: Swingui TestRunner
msgSnippet: I think some of the reason people don t use the SwingUI in their main method is because of the desire to use dynamic loading - with a GUI there s the notion
messageBody:
I think some of the reason people don't use the SwingUI in their main
method is because of the desire to use dynamic loading - with a GUI
there's the notion that the GUI testrunner will be running and will load
new classes as/when they become available, so the GUI testrunner should
run *its* main(), rather than the class that contains the tests.

Toby
P.S.
My biggest gripe is why aren't the test runners properly documented?
Nothing in the API docs, nothing in the "how to" docs of any
consequence. It surprises me that the main entry point of use is not
well documented!
